revised_title: Derivation of Optical Field Quantization from Absorber Theory
tldr: The author develops a quantum absorber theory of optical field quantization, where only matter is quantized by postulate. The optical field amplitudes are expressed in terms of atomic source operators of surrounding absorber atoms, resulting in a mathematically identical description to the conventionally quantized optical field but with a different physical interpretation. This theory considers stationary two-level absorbing atoms and electric dipole fields.
